title: Can a Person be Hypnotized Against their Will? A Delicate and Serious Scientific Discussion.
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, the author described the power of hypnotism and how it can affect individuals. However, in the following text, the author explores the resistance of individuals to hypnotism and the circumstances under which it is possible. The author explains that while it is true that individuals cannot be hypnotized against their will, those who have already been hypnotized can be susceptible to it. The text discusses the power that hypnotists have over their subjects, which is not limited to sleep but can also extend to wakefulness and the ability to carry out complex or even criminal acts. Despite this, the author suggests that there is a corrective to this power, which will be explored in the following text.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while the power of hypnotism is a delicate and potentially grave issue both scientifically and socially, there is a safeguard against abuse. By suggesting to those susceptible to hypnosis that no one can hypnotize them for a set period, they become immune to unwanted influence. This precaution is useful for those who wish to protect themselves from potential harm.
